page.title: 13 St James the Apostle Church
page.content: The church is situated to the west side of the village street in Grafton Underwood. To reach the church you have to cross the stream via one of the footbridges. It is surrounded by tall chestnut trees and fields beyond. It is a stone building about 700 years old surrounded by a pleasant grave yard. The rector has three churches to serve, Grafton, Cranford and Twywell. The service times change each week so each village gets a service at different times from the rector. They are at 9.30 am, 11.15 am or 6.00 pm.
